Piratini, August 9, 1837. Senhor Antônio José Gonçalves Chaves.

The day before yesterday I received two letters from you dated the 9th of last month, and having to reply to them I will begin with the first. I had 1,500 pesos sent for the purchase of an item that was needed by the State as well as 600$000 to Renovato: and although I did not find grounds in my brother-in-law's order, it was nevertheless good; because I owe Renovato only four hundred and sixty thousand réis, which Your Mercy...

Senhor Pelotas; I have already written to him about the paper money and he replied that he had sent it to Your Mercy.

Perhaps very soon we shall see each other there; and on this date I send my orders for the slaves to be sent to you if you have treated them well, each at 16 pesos, both in winter and summer. I will now proceed to your second letter. The slaves, as I told you, belong to my brother-in-law João Rodrigues Barcelos; I have even made this clear to Victorica, informing him that if he did not approve or send to fetch them, he should replace the money I asked for in advance, which, fortunately, my wife had not yet received: therefore, I send them to Your Mercy.

As for the jaguars I requested, it is enough that you send me only twenty, since I have been able to withdraw, etc., etc. I am now writing to my father-in-law about what Your Mercy...

I repeat that you will have me there soon, and then we will talk at ease. I wish you all prosperity for being in truth your faithful and old friend.

(a) Domingos José de Almeida.

NB — Everything that Bernardina requests must be sent, as she will see to dressing the blacks as soon as they arrive there.

(a) Almeida.

Most Illustrious Senhor Antônio José Gonçalves Chaves, Montevideo.
